pageContext.claim: “So, we right now have a trade deficit with Mexico of $71 billion and that doesn’t include all the drugs that pour in over the border because we don’t have a wall et cetera; okay? $71 billion. 71 billion. So, we have – think of it – we have a trade deficit with Mexico of $71 billion.”
pageContext.analysis: Trump, as is his practice, inflates the size of the trade deficit by only counting goods, not goods and services. The 2016 trade deficit with Mexico was $56 billion.
